definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once

sentences.english: Fourth, solve problems through consultation on an equal footing, instead of imposing restriction at will.
sentences.chinese: 通過平等協商解決問題，不要動輒設限和制裁。

sentences.english: Equal competition is the core of market order.
sentences.chinese: 平等競爭是市場秩序的核心。

sentences.english: In the spirit of gender-equality, a male-only carriage must be introduced.
sentences.chinese: 本着男女平等的精神，必須設立男士專用車廂。

sentences.english: Article 105 Women enjoy equal rights with men in civil law.
sentences.chinese: 第一百零五條婦女享有同男子平等的民事權利。

sentences.english: The information-non-reciprocity structure leads to opportunity inequality through the social capital.
sentences.chinese: 信息不對等結構通過社會資本機制導致機會不平等。

sentences.english: Policy-makers need to be aiming for gender-neutral policies.
sentences.chinese: 決策者需要致力於制定性別平等的政策。

sentences.english: This means all body parts are born equal.
sentences.chinese: 這完全體現了所有器官生而平等的理論。

sentences.english: South Korea created a cabinet-level ministry responsible for gender equality.
sentences.chinese: 韓國設立了專門負責性別平等問題的內閣部門。

sentences.english: The teacher's democratic attitude made her popular among her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 該教師平等待人的態度時她受到了學生的愛戴。

sentences.english: We have trade under equal bases.
sentences.chinese: 我們是在平等的基礎上進行貿易。

sentences.english: All the rules are to supply fair and equal conditions and basis for the competion.
sentences.chinese: 各項規則是爲競賽提供公平和平等的條件和依據。

sentences.english: In archery people in wheelchairs can compete on equal terms with the able-bodied.
sentences.chinese: 在箭術比賽中，坐輪椅的人可以跟健全的人平等競爭。

sentences.english: Fifth, there are equal spaces between words and non-meaning-unit characters.
sentences.chinese: 第五，有平等的詞與詞之間的空間和非含義單位字符。

sentences.english: The proposal for a level playing field demands, of course, equal education.
sentences.chinese: 等同地位競爭的提議，需要平等教育。

sentences.english: The hostility between the weak and the strong, the existence of inequality in our world.
sentences.chinese: 弱者與強者的敵對，世間所存在的不平等性。

sentences.english: Institutional social inequalities existed such as slavery and human sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 一些社會的不平等以及存在，如奴隸和活人獻祭。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
